germany opens world cup without ballack -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 06.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 germany opens world cup without ballack großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : michael ballack , the most important man in germany , is out of action on friday rumors about german team captain michael ballack 's presence at the world cup curtain raiser against costa rica have been laid to rest - the star midfielder will be spending the game on the bench . german coach jürgen klinsmann dashed germany 's hopes on friday when he ruled out captain michael ballack , suffering from a calf strain , in the opener against costa rica on friday . tim borowski will take ballack 's place instead in the all-important curtain raiser . earlier on friday , ballack declared himself fit and eager to play . he was quoted by a german paper as saying he feels fine and wants to play . " i 've had intensive treatment , " he told mass-circulation bild .
" i feel fit , i 'm pain-free .
i want to play . " " i want to play , " screamed the headline on the top selling bild newspaper and television and radio seized on the story , filling their programmes with renewed speculation on the state of " the country 's calf " . wait over bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : costa rica - not to be under-estimated the waiting is finally over , as germany kick off the 2006 soccer world cup finals against costa rica in munich .
fans from around the globe have descended on the country to cheer on their national teams . ballack had missed the final training session in munich because of an injury to a calf muscle he picked up against colombia a week ago and appeared to be ruled out of the opener . world cup organizer franz beckenbauer , meanwhile , had warned against ballack playing too soon , and insisted his injury is simply too risky . " a calf injury is dangerous , " he said .
" it 's important to be careful .
if something were to happen to him then he would be completely out of the running , " he said on morning television . challengers bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the team 's been training hard costa rica fans seem to be free of the problems dogging their opponents at the moment , and spent thursday fine-tuning their game . klinsmann says the central americans should n't be underestimated . " we have a lot of respect for costa rica like all our opponents , " said the coach .
" they are a strong side , with four or five very good players . " " we want to play at full pace from the first minute onwards and try and get the crowd behind us , " he said . and if that works , germany hope they can make their mark on the world cup from the very first game . dw staff -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germany captain michael ballack out for opener germany captain michael ballack wo n't be fit enough to take the field in the 2006 world cup opener against costa rica on friday , team coach jürgen klinsmann announced thursday .
-lrb- june 8 , 2006 -rrb- hosts plot costa rica 's downfall as world cup kicks off the waiting is almost over .
nearly six years after germany was awarded the 2006 world cup , the globe 's biggest soccer spectacle is ready to kick-off in munich friday with the hosts playing costa rica in the first game .
-lrb- june 9 , 2006 -rrb- germany captain ballack criticizes klinsmann 's tactics german captain michael ballack has taken issue with coach jürgen klinsmann 's tactics just eight days before the world cup host 's opening match against costa rica .

live ticker : germany 4:2 costa rica -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 14.12.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 live ticker : germany 4:2 costa rica review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . welcome to the world cup kick-off ! !
the wait is over .
germany , the host nation , finally makes good on all the promises and delivers the globe 's most prestigious soccer event to the world .
the fifa world cup stadium münchen plays host to the opening game between jürgen klinsmann 's germany and central american hopefuls costa rica .
stay tuned for all the action as the world cup action unfolds here with dw-world.de 's live ticker less than 45 minutes to go !
the capacity crowd in the fifa world cup stadium münchen has already enjoyed a spectacular opening ceremony with traditional bavarian dancers and a host of international stars .
stars from the history of the world cup have also been paraded in front of the expectant fans as the clock ticks down to kick-off team line-ups announced the teams have been announced and there is no place in the germany team for the injured michael ballack .
tim borowski takes his place in midfield and bernd schneider takes over the captaincy .
germany : lehmann jens , friedrich arne , schweinsteiger bastian , frings torsten , klose miroslav , lahm philipp , mertesacker per , borowski tim , schneider bernd -lrb- c -rrb- , podolski lukas , metzelder christoph costa rica : porras jose -lrb- c -rrb- , marin luis , umana michael , martinez gilberto , fonseca danny , solis mauricio , wanchope paulo , centeno walter , gomez ronald , gonzalez leonardo , sequeira douglas klinsmann sticks with winning line-up germany coach jürgen klinsmann has gone with the same team - minus ballack - who dispensed with costa rica 's central american counterparts colombia 3-0 in germany 's last test game with lehmann in goal , the back four remains arne friedrich , philipp lahm , per mertesacker and christoph metzelder .
the midfield consists of schweinsteiger , frings , schneider and borowski while lukas podolski and miroslav klose start up front .
the crowd awaits the teams the german and costa rican teams are lining up in the bowels of the stadium , ready to exit to what is expected to be a deafening reception in munich as they prepare to get the 2006 fifa world cup underway .
the stadium is a sea of colors and a cauldron of song as the flags of the teams are brought out onto the pitch precipitating the arrival of the teams .
the teams exit to rapturous applause germany and costa rica come out onto the prestine pitch as the world cup gets ready to get underway .
the costa rican national anthem sounds out with enthusiastic singing from the team and their supporters .
the german anthem is belted out by the host team and the fans respectfully join in .
it is a more solemn chorus than the preceding anthem but one of pride as germany prepares to host the greatest soccer show on earth .
1. min .
the 2006 world cup gets underway costa rica kicks off to begin the first game in the 2006 fifa world cup .
1. min .
an early surge through the midfield from costa rica results in the first free kick .
1. min .
the free kick is chipped inot the far post but its too long for the striker centeno .
2. min .
germany get their first chance to build an attack on the left flank with schweinsteiger and lahm working well .
a hard tackle from marin ends their progress .
2. min .
frings long range effort flies just over germany build from the midfield and the ball falls to frings who rifles in a dipping long range shot which just flies over .
6. min .
goal germany ! ! 6. min .
philipp lahm curls in a beauty left-back philipp lahm cuts in from the flank , drops his shoulder and fires a curling long range effort over porras into the far right hand corner .
a great opening goal ! 9. min .
germany are running riot over the costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over the costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
klose closes in on goal a lovely through ball from borowski almost gets klose in but porras rushes out of the goal to smother the shot and beat the ball away .
12. min .
goal costa rica 12. min .
wanchope beats the offside trap germany were left calling for offside but wanchope gathers the ball and sweeps it past lehmann .
17. min .
goal germany klose gathers a cut back from scweinsteiger to sweep germany back into the lead ! 18. min .
great work from germany for the goal bernd schneider laid a lovely ball back from the right flank to catch schweinsteiger 's run into the box and the clever ball to klose left the striker with the easy task to knock in germany 's second .
20. min .
podolski fires in a rocket lukas podolski looks to increase the lead by rifling in a 20 meter shot which porras fails to hold at the first attempt .
he gathers at the second and the danger passes .
24. min .
despite being two-one down , the costa ricans are battling hard .
germany are faster on the break and looking dangerous but the hosts are having to defend staunchly as costa rica continue to threaten .
27. min .
again schweinsteiger is played in by schneider .
the winger dances past one challenge and threads a ball to borowski in the box .
his shot is blocked at the last minute .
29. min .
danny fonseca gets the first card 29. min .
costa rica 's midfielder gets booked for a harsh challenge on borowski .
35. min .
costa rica try and beat the offside trap again as they did on their first goal but this time the flag rules against the attempt on goal .
41. min .
schweinsteiger whips in a low corner from the right which evades everyone except christoph metzelder at the far post .
he waves a boot at the ball and it balloons over the bar .
an attacker in the same position may have made it 3-1 .
45. min .
half-time sounds with germany out on top half-time : germany go into the break in control of the game by way of goals , possession and chances .
costa rica look to have run out of ideas but there is still a whiff of danger in their attacks .
there could well be more goals in this game for both sides .
45. min .
second half : germany kick off the second half gets underway with germany leading costa rica 2-1 .
the host nation look to capitalize on their showing at the end of the first period and sew the game up .
costa rica will be looking for a way back into the match .
45. min .
germany start by firing in a rising shot from tom borowski just over the bar within seconds of the restart .
50. min .
germany continue to push forward and are frustrating the costa ricans .
a chipped cross from schneider is headed just wide by borowski .
55. min .
klinsmann gets david odonkor and oliver neuville warming up on the sidelines as he considers his options .
concentration seems to be slipping with some of the germany players and they have been forced into mistakes by the costa ricans in the past five minutes .
60. min .
goal germany 60. min .
klose follows up to make it 3-1 lahm sends over an out-swinging cross which klose heads goalwards .
porras saves but klose follows up and lifts the ball over the keeper and into the roof of the net .
65. min .
germany are coasting now with a two-goal cushion but look to score more goals and kill the game off .
paulo wanchope is a lone figure as costa rica gets everyone behind the ball .
67. min .
costa rica bring on jarvis drummond for gilberto martinez .
69. min .
philipp lahm is having an enjoyable afternoon on the left flank .
the left back races past two defenders on the wing , cuts inside before bearing down on goal .
he tries to poke the ball under porras but gets no power and the keeper saves easily .
71. min .
sebastian kehl enters the fray klinsmann takes off the hard-working borowski for sebastian kehl to freshen the midfield .
72. min .
goal costa rica 72. min .
wanchope gets his second paulo wanchope gets his and costa rica 's second as confusion reigns in the german defense .
wanchope slips through the two central defenders to recieve a lofted ball and hesitates slightly before stroking the ball past jens lehmann who stays rooted to the spot .
78. min .
costa rica substitution mauricio solis comes off for bolanos as costa rica look to stage a shocking comeback .
78. min .
two-goal klose comes off oliver neuville comes on for germany 's two-goal hero miro klose .
80. min .
germany want the game won and per mertesacker thumps a header straight at porras as the hosts search for a way to kill off the resurgent costa ricans .
85. min .
schneider loses position in the box and is lucky not get booked for the dive that follows .
the advantage is played to costa rica and the counter-attack begins .
86. min .
goal germany 86. min .
frings lets rip from 40 meters !
an absolute rocket from torsten frings puts the game beyond costa rica 's reach with a monster shot which flie into the top right hand corner from 40 meters out .
schweinsteiger played the ball square into the midfielder 's path and he hit it on the run .
90. min .
germany substitution david odonkor comes on for bernd schneider 90. min .
costa rica substitution azofeifa comes on for gomez .
90 + 3. min .
germany win the opening game the whistle goes and germany wins the match 4-2 and starts the 2006 world cup in style . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .

live ticker : germany 4:2 costa rica -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 28.09.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 live ticker : germany 4:2 costa rica review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . welcome to the world cup kick-off ! !
the wait is over .
germany , the host nation , finally makes good on all the promises and delivers the globe 's most prestigious soccer event to the world .
the fifa world cup stadium münchen plays host to the opening game between jürgen klinsmann 's germany and central american hopefuls costa rica .
stay tuned for all the action as the world cup action unfolds here with dw-world.de 's live ticker less than 45 minutes to go !
the capacity crowd in the fifa world cup stadium münchen has already enjoyed a spectacular opening ceremony with traditional bavarian dancers and a host of international stars .
stars from the history of the world cup have also been paraded in front of the expectant fans as the clock ticks down to kick-off team line-ups announced the teams have been announced and there is no place in the germany team for the injured michael ballack .
tim borowski takes his place in midfield and bernd schneider takes over the captaincy .
germany : lehmann jens , friedrich arne , schweinsteiger bastian , frings torsten , klose miroslav , lahm philipp , mertesacker per , borowski tim , schneider bernd -lrb- c -rrb- , podolski lukas , metzelder christoph costa rica : porras jose -lrb- c -rrb- , marin luis , umana michael , martinez gilberto , fonseca danny , solis mauricio , wanchope paulo , centeno walter , gomez ronald , gonzalez leonardo , sequeira douglas klinsmann sticks with winning line-up germany coach jürgen klinsmann has gone with the same team - minus ballack - who dispensed with costa rica 's central american counterparts colombia 3-0 in germany 's last test game with lehmann in goal , the back four remains arne friedrich , philipp lahm , per mertesacker and christoph metzelder .
the midfield consists of schweinsteiger , frings , schneider and borowski while lukas podolski and miroslav klose start up front .
the crowd awaits the teams the german and costa rican teams are lining up in the bowels of the stadium , ready to exit to what is expected to be a deafening reception in munich as they prepare to get the 2006 fifa world cup underway .
the stadium is a sea of colors and a cauldron of song as the flags of the teams are brought out onto the pitch precipitating the arrival of the teams .
the teams exit to rapturous applause germany and costa rica come out onto the prestine pitch as the world cup gets ready to get underway .
the costa rican national anthem sounds out with enthusiastic singing from the team and their supporters .
the german anthem is belted out by the host team and the fans respectfully join in .
it is a more solemn chorus than the preceding anthem but one of pride as germany prepares to host the greatest soccer show on earth .
1. min .
the 2006 world cup gets underway costa rica kicks off to begin the first game in the 2006 fifa world cup .
1. min .
an early surge through the midfield from costa rica results in the first free kick .
1. min .
the free kick is chipped inot the far post but its too long for the striker centeno .
2. min .
germany get their first chance to build an attack on the left flank with schweinsteiger and lahm working well .
a hard tackle from marin ends their progress .
2. min .
frings long range effort flies just over germany build from the midfield and the ball falls to frings who rifles in a dipping long range shot which just flies over .
6. min .
goal germany ! ! 6. min .
philipp lahm curls in a beauty left-back philipp lahm cuts in from the flank , drops his shoulder and fires a curling long range effort over porras into the far right hand corner .
a great opening goal ! 9. min .
germany are running riot over the costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over the costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
klose closes in on goal a lovely through ball from borowski almost gets klose in but porras rushes out of the goal to smother the shot and beat the ball away .
12. min .
goal costa rica 12. min .
wanchope beats the offside trap germany were left calling for offside but wanchope gathers the ball and sweeps it past lehmann .
17. min .
goal germany klose gathers a cut back from scweinsteiger to sweep germany back into the lead ! 18. min .
great work from germany for the goal bernd schneider laid a lovely ball back from the right flank to catch schweinsteiger 's run into the box and the clever ball to klose left the striker with the easy task to knock in germany 's second .
20. min .
podolski fires in a rocket lukas podolski looks to increase the lead by rifling in a 20 meter shot which porras fails to hold at the first attempt .
he gathers at the second and the danger passes .
24. min .
despite being two-one down , the costa ricans are battling hard .
germany are faster on the break and looking dangerous but the hosts are having to defend staunchly as costa rica continue to threaten .
27. min .
again schweinsteiger is played in by schneider .
the winger dances past one challenge and threads a ball to borowski in the box .
his shot is blocked at the last minute .
29. min .
danny fonseca gets the first card 29. min .
costa rica 's midfielder gets booked for a harsh challenge on borowski .
35. min .
costa rica try and beat the offside trap again as they did on their first goal but this time the flag rules against the attempt on goal .
41. min .
schweinsteiger whips in a low corner from the right which evades everyone except christoph metzelder at the far post .
he waves a boot at the ball and it balloons over the bar .
an attacker in the same position may have made it 3-1 .
45. min .
half-time sounds with germany out on top half-time : germany go into the break in control of the game by way of goals , possession and chances .
costa rica look to have run out of ideas but there is still a whiff of danger in their attacks .
there could well be more goals in this game for both sides .
45. min .
second half : germany kick off the second half gets underway with germany leading costa rica 2-1 .
the host nation look to capitalize on their showing at the end of the first period and sew the game up .
costa rica will be looking for a way back into the match .
45. min .
germany start by firing in a rising shot from tom borowski just over the bar within seconds of the restart .
50. min .
germany continue to push forward and are frustrating the costa ricans .
a chipped cross from schneider is headed just wide by borowski .
55. min .
klinsmann gets david odonkor and oliver neuville warming up on the sidelines as he considers his options .
concentration seems to be slipping with some of the germany players and they have been forced into mistakes by the costa ricans in the past five minutes .
60. min .
goal germany 60. min .
klose follows up to make it 3-1 lahm sends over an out-swinging cross which klose heads goalwards .
porras saves but klose follows up and lifts the ball over the keeper and into the roof of the net .
65. min .
germany are coasting now with a two-goal cushion but look to score more goals and kill the game off .
paulo wanchope is a lone figure as costa rica gets everyone behind the ball .
67. min .
costa rica bring on jarvis drummond for gilberto martinez .
69. min .
philipp lahm is having an enjoyable afternoon on the left flank .
the left back races past two defenders on the wing , cuts inside before bearing down on goal .
he tries to poke the ball under porras but gets no power and the keeper saves easily .
71. min .
sebastian kehl enters the fray klinsmann takes off the hard-working borowski for sebastian kehl to freshen the midfield .
72. min .
goal costa rica 72. min .
wanchope gets his second paulo wanchope gets his and costa rica 's second as confusion reigns in the german defense .
wanchope slips through the two central defenders to recieve a lofted ball and hesitates slightly before stroking the ball past jens lehmann who stays rooted to the spot .
78. min .
costa rica substitution mauricio solis comes off for bolanos as costa rica look to stage a shocking comeback .
78. min .
two-goal klose comes off oliver neuville comes on for germany 's two-goal hero miro klose .
80. min .
germany want the game won and per mertesacker thumps a header straight at porras as the hosts search for a way to kill off the resurgent costa ricans .
85. min .
schneider loses position in the box and is lucky not get booked for the dive that follows .
the advantage is played to costa rica and the counter-attack begins .
86. min .
goal germany 86. min .
frings lets rip from 40 meters !
an absolute rocket from torsten frings puts the game beyond costa rica 's reach with a monster shot which flie into the top right hand corner from 40 meters out .
schweinsteiger played the ball square into the midfielder 's path and he hit it on the run .
90. min .
germany substitution david odonkor comes on for bernd schneider 90. min .
costa rica substitution azofeifa comes on for gomez .
90 + 3. min .
germany win the opening game the whistle goes and germany wins the match 4-2 and starts the 2006 world cup in style . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .

love 's labor lost on the german highway -pipe- news -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 01.06.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de news -pipe- 09.06.2006 love 's labor lost on the german highway großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : love was in the air , but the world turned a blind eye to it again in a shakespearean play , he would have exclaimed " i love , i sue , i seek a wife !
a woman that is like a german clock . "
this , however , is a story about why a german teenager will grow to be a bitter , old man . at the beginning of shakespeare 's poetic comedy love 's labor lost , king ferdinand of spain declares that his court will be devoted to ascetic study .
he lays out the rules of the game by imposing three conditions on his courtiers : no women allowed within a mile of the court , obligatory fasting once a week , and no more than three hours of sleep per night . what a great way to increase concentration ! the bard of avon , despite his literary genius , did n't know that king ferdinand 's experiment - in addition to being destined to fail - was pretty accurately describing the main symptoms of the 21st century 's malaise de mode , the new ascetism , namely internet dependency . an increasing number of people and , especially , all those new kids on the block , are living in a twisted universe in which physical contact with the human species is reduced to a bare minimum .
they inhabit a world in which nourishment comes as an accidental afterthought in between playing the angel of darkness online and looking for an internet hot date whose online profile matches the looks and curves of laura croft .
and they are often stuck in a time warp in which sleep-deprivation and hours in front of the computer screen lead to hallucinatory experiences that in the not so distant past required serious drug abuse . these kids have no idea what the psychedelic seventies were about . tour d 'amour yet despite what the pale-faced cassandras of this world will tell you about humanity 's impeding doom and cultural downfall , the last glimmer of hope has not been entirely extinguished .
for some people , it is still love , in its pure madness and untainted naiveté , that makes the world go around .
or , at least , makes us go around the world . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : when love is concerned , no vehicle is fast enough - especially a bike one such brave defender of stirred up emotions - a lovesick 16-year-old german boy - hopped on his bicycle in hamm , in the western german state of north-rhine westphalia , and cycled more than 200 kilometers -lrb- 120 miles -rrb- overnight to meet a girl he had met on the internet , german police said on wednesday . very little is known about this boy , except that he will probably stay grounded throughout the fifa world cup . what we do know is that he chose not be cynical , although on that fateful night he could 've simply kept chewing on pringles and dinking can after can of cherry coke .
he also could have been a little more cautious , wondering whether his internet sweetheart was , in fact , one of those german tabloid anti-heroes , who - in a state of drunken stupor and , despite the freudian banality of it all - attack their retired neighbors with a bockwurst , sometimes with fatal consequences . like a shakespearean hero who overdosed on love potion , the young german rose above cultural stereotypes and societal prejudices .
he broke the chains of internet dependency .
he took no map , no money or food .
he also did n't ask for his parents ' permission , but ventured out into the unknown , following his heart . a thwarted attempt bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a happy ending is never guaranteed unfortunately , there always comes a moment in which the prosaics of life takes over the poetic imagination .
in bremen , some two thirds of the way to hamburg , where he was headed , the boy got lost .
well-behaved and well-brought up as he is , he went to the first police station to ask for directions from kind german policemen , fully trained to make the world feel at home during the soccer championship . big mistake !
german police officers - despite their recent training in exchanging polite remarks and reducing the fear factor - are not exactly the most romantic guys around .
cops rarely get pensive while watching the sunset .
they are into chasing criminals and showing off their guns , not sobbing at the end of sleepless in seattle . the police dutifully informed the boy 's parents , who , in their turn , were anything but amused .
they came to pick him up and take him back home to hamm .
there are unconfirmed reports that some huffing and puffing was involved . the unsuspecting girl in hamburg knew nothing about her suitor 's exertions .
he said he had wanted to surprise her . no wonder kids turn out pessimistic and distrustful when they grow up . toma tasovac send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de love-struck german judge turns blind eye to justice wearing black robes and being addressed as " your honor " apparently does n't keep people from doing really , really stupid things , as one love-struck german judge recently proved .
-lrb- jan .
25 , 2006 -rrb- a bicycle thief with a heart who says thieves are hardened criminals ?
a german cycling around the world for over four decades had his bicycle stolen .
but the thief must have had a soft spot for his resolute appeal to the media .
-lrb- may 10 , 2006 -rrb- the best of " from the fringe " click here for a list of quirkiest stories from dw-world 's series " from the fringe " 9798 radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour dw-world.de check out our latest interactive web features dw screensaver social bookmarking our rss feeds dw widgets integrated search dw on facebook newsletters netvibes.com the way you want it mobile optimized for pdas newsletters news in your inbox audio / video podcasts © dw 2011 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

german press review : love it or hate it , there 's no escape -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 23.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 german press review : love it or hate it , there 's no escape großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : what are they writing about us ? - costa rican players have a look at a german paper as the world cup finally gets underway in munich on friday , the country 's newspapers say the four-week spectacle offers germany the chance for an image makeover .
others ask whether the hoopla is n't just a bit too much . no matter how you look at the world cup , it 's always close to the official motto of " a time to make friends , " wrote the karlsruhe-based badische neueste nachrichten .
" germany wants to present itself as an open , good-natured , dynamic country , " the paper said .
" if it manages that , the benefits would be immeasurable . " bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : wil the motto " a time to make friends " translate into a real feeling ?
that view is shared by the heilbronner stimme which opined that germany would be a winner - irrespective of how it performed on the pitch - if the official world cup motto translated into a tangible feeling for the fans .
" people expect perfect organization from the germans , but not warmth and joie de vivre .
the world cup offers the chance for an image makeover in a very simple way , " the paper wrote .
" the nicest praise would be the conclusion : germany is different . " the dresden-based sächsische zeitung wrote that the world has noticed that germany is making an effort and is showing off its best side .
" the london times writes that germany is ready for a new image , the dutch are writing friendly things about us and the danes are discovering new success stories about the ' world champs in organization , " ' the paper wrote .
" of course clichés still persist .
but it shows that germany can and will change its image through the mammoth soccer event , despite the recent xenophobic attacks , " the daily said . some newspapers also took a jibe at the commercial hoopla and hype that has consumed the event . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : some wonder if germany has n't gone overboard with soccer mania " if all that 's been written and said in the past months is true , then a real multifunctional world cup is heading towards this country , " the münchner merkur wrote .
it added that the biggest soccer event of the world was meant to kick-start the economy , create jobs , lift sagging spirits and present the image of a modern , friendly germany abroad .
" that 's quite a lot for a single tournament and we have n't even begun to talk about soccer as yet , " the paper wrote .
it all adds up to a sated feeling , almost one of reluctance for the ordinary citizen , it said .
" you might say that all this is now a part of modern sport , you ca n't change it .
the opening game should put things in perspective . " " it would be wonderful if modernizer klinsmann is successful and his team cuts a brave figure .
that could revive germans ' belief in their own abilities , " the southern german augsburger allgemeine wrote .
the paper however reminded that the euphoria of germany winning the last world cup , in 1990 - the year that german reunification took place - did n't last long .
" the world cup does n't solve our problems . " berlin-based daily der tagesspiegel commented that there were several people who are completely annoyed by the whole hype surrounding the event and do n't care about it all .
" a game !
is n't there anything more important than that ? " the paper asked rhetorically .
" but there is some comfort for those who ca n't stand the world cup - it 's over in 33 days , " the daily wrote .
" but everyone - even those who hate it - will have something special at the end of the tournament : the memory of a world cup in your own country . " dw staff -lrb- sp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de hosts plot costa rica 's downfall as world cup kicks off the waiting is almost over .
nearly six years after germany was awarded the 2006 world cup , the globe 's biggest soccer spectacle is ready to kick-off in munich friday with the hosts playing costa rica in the first game .
-lrb- june 9 , 2006 -rrb- some soccer fans want to reclaim the game the world cup , which starts friday , will be the culmination of two years of hype that has left no marketing stone unturned .
for " true " fans , it has become capitalistic excess and some are rebelling .
-lrb- june 8 , 2006 -rrb- german hosts marginalized by fifa 's occupying power if there was any doubt , this is fifa 's world cup .
world soccer 's governing body has assumed almost total control and the german hosts are increasingly pushed aside .
there is , not surprisingly , trouble in soccer paradise .

for more information , please click here .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 german press review : love it or hate it , there 's no escape großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : what are they writing about us ? - costa rican players have a look at a german paper as the world cup finally gets underway in munich on friday , the country 's newspapers say the four-week spectacle offers germany the chance for an image makeover .
others ask whether the hoopla is n't just a bit too much . no matter how you look at the world cup , it 's always close to the official motto of " a time to make friends , " wrote the karlsruhe-based badische neueste nachrichten .
" germany wants to present itself as an open , good-natured , dynamic country , " the paper said .
" if it manages that , the benefits would be immeasurable . " bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : wil the motto " a time to make friends " translate into a real feeling ?
that view is shared by the heilbronner stimme which opined that germany would be a winner - irrespective of how it performed on the pitch - if the official world cup motto translated into a tangible feeling for the fans .
" people expect perfect organization from the germans , but not warmth and joie de vivre .
the world cup offers the chance for an image makeover in a very simple way , " the paper wrote .
" the nicest praise would be the conclusion : germany is different . " the dresden-based sächsische zeitung wrote that the world has noticed that germany is making an effort and is showing off its best side .
" the london times writes that germany is ready for a new image , the dutch are writing friendly things about us and the danes are discovering new success stories about the ' world champs in organization , " ' the paper wrote .
" of course clichés still persist .
but it shows that germany can and will change its image through the mammoth soccer event , despite the recent xenophobic attacks , " the daily said . some newspapers also took a jibe at the commercial hoopla and hype that has consumed the event . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : some wonder if germany has n't gone overboard with soccer mania " if all that 's been written and said in the past months is true , then a real multifunctional world cup is heading towards this country , " the münchner merkur wrote .
it added that the biggest soccer event of the world was meant to kick-start the economy , create jobs , lift sagging spirits and present the image of a modern , friendly germany abroad .
" that 's quite a lot for a single tournament and we have n't even begun to talk about soccer as yet , " the paper wrote .
it all adds up to a sated feeling , almost one of reluctance for the ordinary citizen , it said .
" you might say that all this is now a part of modern sport , you ca n't change it .
the opening game should put things in perspective . " " it would be wonderful if modernizer klinsmann is successful and his team cuts a brave figure .
that could revive germans ' belief in their own abilities , " the southern german augsburger allgemeine wrote .
the paper however reminded that the euphoria of germany winning the last world cup , in 1990 - the year that german reunification took place - did n't last long .
" the world cup does n't solve our problems . " berlin-based daily der tagesspiegel commented that there were several people who are completely annoyed by the whole hype surrounding the event and do n't care about it all .
" a game !
is n't there anything more important than that ? " the paper asked rhetorically .
" but there is some comfort for those who ca n't stand the world cup - it 's over in 33 days , " the daily wrote .
" but everyone - even those who hate it - will have something special at the end of the tournament : the memory of a world cup in your own country . " dw staff -lrb- sp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de hosts plot costa rica 's downfall as world cup kicks off the waiting is almost over .
nearly six years after germany was awarded the 2006 world cup , the globe 's biggest soccer spectacle is ready to kick-off in munich friday with the hosts playing costa rica in the first game .
-lrb- june 9 , 2006 -rrb- some soccer fans want to reclaim the game the world cup , which starts friday , will be the culmination of two years of hype that has left no marketing stone unturned .
for " true " fans , it has become capitalistic excess and some are rebelling .
-lrb- june 8 , 2006 -rrb- german hosts marginalized by fifa 's occupying power if there was any doubt , this is fifa 's world cup .
world soccer 's governing body has assumed almost total control and the german hosts are increasingly pushed aside .
there is , not surprisingly , trouble in soccer paradise .
-lrb- june 7 , 2006 -rrb- 9798 dw-tv europe live journal - nachrichten mit tagesthema we 're sorry , due to legal issues this content can not be transmitted as live stream .
if you are inside the united states , it is still possible for you to enjoy dw-tv .
for more information , please click here .
dw-radio live newslink plus listen live gallery the world cup in pictures standings world cup rankings keep track of the latest results and rankings with dw-world.de 's score board .
the best of germany germany has much that is worth celebrating .
here dw-world presents 100 reasons to love germany .
germany 's train stations play the game join in the world cup fun with dw 's interactive sites .
shoot a goal predict the winners visit germany exploring deutschland check out dw-world 's section with tips and reports from all parts of the country .
readers ' corner germany 's defeat dw-world.de readers were crushed by germany 's defeat in the world cup but saw a silver lining . © dw 2011 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

" of course clichés still persist .
but it shows that germany can and will change its image through the mammoth soccer event , despite the recent xenophobic attacks , " the daily said . some newspapers also took a jibe at the commercial hoopla and hype that has consumed the event . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : some wonder if germany has n't gone overboard with soccer mania " if all that 's been written and said in the past months is true , then a real multifunctional world cup is heading towards this country , " the münchner merkur wrote .
it added that the biggest soccer event of the world was meant to kick-start the economy , create jobs , lift sagging spirits and present the image of a modern , friendly germany abroad .
" that 's quite a lot for a single tournament and we have n't even begun to talk about soccer as yet , " the paper wrote .
it all adds up to a sated feeling , almost one of reluctance for the ordinary citizen , it said .
" you might say that all this is now a part of modern sport , you ca n't change it .
the opening game should put things in perspective . " " it would be wonderful if modernizer klinsmann is successful and his team cuts a brave figure .
that could revive germans ' belief in their own abilities , " the southern german augsburger allgemeine wrote .
the paper however reminded that the euphoria of germany winning the last world cup , in 1990 - the year that german reunification took place - did n't last long .
" the world cup does n't solve our problems . " berlin-based daily der tagesspiegel commented that there were several people who are completely annoyed by the whole hype surrounding the event and do n't care about it all .
" a game !
is n't there anything more important than that ? " the paper asked rhetorically .
" but there is some comfort for those who ca n't stand the world cup - it 's over in 33 days , " the daily wrote .
" but everyone - even those who hate it - will have something special at the end of the tournament : the memory of a world cup in your own country . there is , not surprisingly , trouble in soccer paradise .

germany keeps visa requirements tight for world cup -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 28.03.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 germany keeps visa requirements tight for world cup großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany hopes to limit the number of illegal immigrants entering during the world cup host nation germany waits to welcome the world to the world cup but it seems that some members of the global community are less welcome than others . the federal interior ministry has been dealing with the logistical headaches of securing the world cup from terrorists and hooligans as well as limiting an expected influx of sex workers and illegal immigrants hoping to set up in germany under the cover of the world cup . while difficult to assess , the security threat is at least one which german authorities can tackle with initiatives and contingency plans .
but the prospect of thousands of people flooding into the country with no intention of leaving after the tournament ends is less easy to deal with , although visa restrictions and increased border controls will at least strengthen the host nation 's hand . germany is preparing to suspend the free travel arrangements it has with certain neighbors under the european union 's schengen agreement and reimpose passport checks on the borders with denmark , austria , france , belgium , luxembourg and the netherlands . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany will reintroduce border controls with eu neighbors the threat of illegal immigrants entering germany during the world cup is a real one .
more than 3 million visitors are expected to come to germany for event but only 45,000 people from the 11 countries from where a visa is required have applied for the necessary entry documents .
the foreign ministry is bracing for a rush on visa applications while the interior ministry is fearing a flood of visitors who do not have the required papers . on top of that , there a further twenty countries , including mexico , costa rica and paraguay , which do not require visas . visa scams put germany on high alert the foreign ministry recently announced that it had uncovered a visa scam in one participating african country in which potential migrants were advised to throw away their passports on arrival and claim asylum .
officials in tunisia also announced recently that they suspected many of those queuing for visas to germany were not soccer fans but people desperate for a ticket to a job and a new life in europe . such news has put germany on high alert .
the federal government has not loosened its visa requirements for non-eu and non-western countries and as a result , fans of countries like ukraine may face disappointment when trying to enter the country to watch the games unless they can fulfill the visa criteria . german embassies around the world have issued warnings to foreign nationals intending to travel to the world cup that having a ticket for the games will not guarantee them a visa or entry . " may be turned back " bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : signing up for tickets ; not applying for a visa the announcements also advise fans that the best way of getting a visa is to have documents proving they have a job , travel health insurance and a return plane ticket .
visa applicants must also prove , in an interview , that they are on a short-term visit and have the funds to travel while in germany . " there will always be applicants , especially from poor countries , who want to come here and stay for economic reasons , " a german foreign ministry spokesperson told dw-world.de.
" it 's a bigger problem at the moment with many coming and claiming to visit the world cup . " " if they ca n't prove they can pay , they may be turned back , " the spokesperson said . dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de ahmadinejad would face cool reception at world cup berlin was reserved in its response to iran 's president saying he would come to the world cup if his team made it beyond the first round .
the head of germany 's soccer association , however , said he would get an earful .
-lrb- june 5 , 2006 -rrb- human trafficking scandal rocks ecuador national team ecuador coach luis fernando suarez , whose side will face germany in its final world cup group stage match on june 20 in berlin , played down the human trafficking scandal ecuadorian national soccer association fef was currently embroiled in .
-lrb- april 15 , 2006 -rrb- person-to-person world cup ticket exchanges banned by court in a blow to soccer fans intent on exchanging world cup tickets on the black market , the german soccer federation -lrb- dfb -rrb- won a court ruling thursday that will make unofficial transactions between ticket holders void .
-lrb- april 26 , 2006 -rrb- www-links fifa world cup 2006 the official homepage of the 2006 fifa world cup in germany .
feedback are you traveling to germany for the world cup ?
have you experienced any problems with you travel arrangements from your home country ?
let us know .
please include your full name and country with any reply .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 germany keeps visa requirements tight for world cup großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany hopes to limit the number of illegal immigrants entering during the world cup host nation germany waits to welcome the world to the world cup but it seems that some members of the global community are less welcome than others . the federal interior ministry has been dealing with the logistical headaches of securing the world cup from terrorists and hooligans as well as limiting an expected influx of sex workers and illegal immigrants hoping to set up in germany under the cover of the world cup . while difficult to assess , the security threat is at least one which german authorities can tackle with initiatives and contingency plans .
but the prospect of thousands of people flooding into the country with no intention of leaving after the tournament ends is less easy to deal with , although visa restrictions and increased border controls will at least strengthen the host nation 's hand . germany is preparing to suspend the free travel arrangements it has with certain neighbors under the european union 's schengen agreement and reimpose passport checks on the borders with denmark , austria , france , belgium , luxembourg and the netherlands . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany will reintroduce border controls with eu neighbors the threat of illegal immigrants entering germany during the world cup is a real one .

the foreign ministry is bracing for a rush on visa applications while the interior ministry is fearing a flood of visitors who do not have the required papers . on top of that , there a further twenty countries , including mexico , costa rica and paraguay , which do not require visas . visa scams put germany on high alert the foreign ministry recently announced that it had uncovered a visa scam in one participating african country in which potential migrants were advised to throw away their passports on arrival and claim asylum .
officials in tunisia also announced recently that they suspected many of those queuing for visas to germany were not soccer fans but people desperate for a ticket to a job and a new life in europe . such news has put germany on high alert .
the federal government has not loosened its visa requirements for non-eu and non-western countries and as a result , fans of countries like ukraine may face disappointment when trying to enter the country to watch the games unless they can fulfill the visa criteria . german embassies around the world have issued warnings to foreign nationals intending to travel to the world cup that having a ticket for the games will not guarantee them a visa or entry . " may be turned back " bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : signing up for tickets ; not applying for a visa the announcements also advise fans that the best way of getting a visa is to have documents proving they have a job , travel health insurance and a return plane ticket .
visa applicants must also prove , in an interview , that they are on a short-term visit and have the funds to travel while in germany . " there will always be applicants , especially from poor countries , who want to come here and stay for economic reasons , " a german foreign ministry spokesperson told dw-world.de.
" it 's a bigger problem at the moment with many coming and claiming to visit the world cup . " " if they ca n't prove they can pay , they may be turned back , " the spokesperson said . dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de ahmadinejad would face cool reception at world cup berlin was reserved in its response to iran 's president saying he would come to the world cup if his team made it beyond the first round .
the head of germany 's soccer association , however , said he would get an earful .

hosts plot costa rica 's downfall as world cup kicks off -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 10.12.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 hosts plot costa rica 's downfall as world cup kicks off großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : will germany still smile friday night ?
the waiting is over .
nearly six years after germany was awarded the 2006 world cup , the globe 's biggest soccer spectacle began in munich friday with the hosts playing costa rica in the first game . since that ecstatic night in zurich on july 6 , 2000 when franz beckenbauer 's glitzy team of soccer legends , celebrities and politicians won the right to stage the tournament , enough column inches have been written on germany 's preparations to stretch from berlin to san jose .
now the real action starts . germany remain confident that their first opponents will not spoil the opening party .
assistant coach joachim löw revealed earlier in the week that the staff and players had studied dvds of the central americans ' warm-up matches and that the belief was that the hosts would get their world cup campaign off to a winning start . " it is the first match and we are a bit nervous but we have done our homework and i think we are in a position to beat costa rica , " löw told reporters .
" if we turn up and show our strengths we will win the match . " germany manager jürgen klinsmann has forced all of his players to watch clips of their opponents and löw claims costa rica were no longer an unknown quantity . " we have collected a lot of information on them by watching dvd clips of league games and international matches , " said löw .
" we know their strengths and weaknesses but of course we will not be discussing them in public . " costa rica n culture , lifestyle as well as tactics studied bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany 's first game will be no san jose beach at sunset klinsmann seems to have left nothing to chance .
the coach has even had his stars studying costa rica 's culture and lifestyle for clues on how their opponents will play in the opening match .
the german team have been viewing a short film about the friendly central american country , famed for its diverse wildlife and the fact that it has no military forces . " we introduced the players to the country , how the people live there and what their mentality is like , " löw added .
" we 've also seen from games that they 're technically skilful and they love to play beautiful soccer .
that 's a reflection of the national character . " germany captain michael ballack , who will not be playing because of injuries , said everyone had enjoyed the lesson . " it was highly educational , " ballack said .
" we all loved hearing about costa rica and getting an insight into the culture . " while having as much knowledge as possible of their opponents will give the german team a sense of preparation , the real revelations will come on the pitch .
and the hosts will be wary of any surprises . coach kli n sma n n set to start with sta n dard formatio n klinsmann is likely to deploy a standard 4-4-2 formation to counter costa rica coach alexandre guimaraes 's promise that his team are going to abandon their nice guy approach and hit their opponents with a new aggressive form of their renowned free-flowing style . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ballack scored against colombia but will he start the first game ?
the defensive back four charged with repelling costa rican strikers alvaro saborio and paulo wanchope is expected to be the one which kept colombia at bay in the last test match : arne friedrich , per metesacker , christoph metzelder and philipp lahm , with new number one jens lehmann tending goal behind them . with ballack missing , the midfield will probably feature bernd schneider , torsten frings and bastian schweinsteiger .
the combative tim borowski is most likely to take ballack 's place while sebastian kehl is also on standby . responsible for getting germany 's first goals of the tournament will be striking partnership miroslav klose and lukas podolski . costa rica 's trai n er says his team is n o soft touch costa rica are unlikely to roll over for the hosts just to get the party started on an upbeat note .
coach guimaraes , who was also in charge four years ago in japan / korea , has returned after the unsuccessful tenure of the american steve sampson and has built a new-look team which are tougher and more mature than in the last world cup when they were considered a soft touch . " before , costa rica were a fair play team , naive and just interested in attacking , " he recently told reporters .
" this time , everybody 's going to notice the difference . "
bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : paulo wanchope still leads the line for costa rica costa rica 's world cup debut performance in italy in 1990 saw them reach the last 16 , shocking scotland and sweden on the way .
guimaraes is optimistic that his team can at least emulate that despite struggling through the qualifying rounds . their main threat will come from paulo wanchope , their all-time leading scorer with 43 goals including eight in the qualifiers .
despite losing some of his pace , the striker has a wealth of international experience garnered from a career spent in the english and spanish leagues . world cup experie n ce from back to fro n t the team 's spine consists of the other remaining members of the class of 2002 ; including defenders harold wallace , luis marin and gilberto martinez , midfield playmaker walter centeno and forward ronald gomez .
but while these players may be well-known , germany will have to be wary of the newcomers alvaro saborio and midfielder carlos hernandez whose inclusion helped turn a near-disastrous qualifying campaign into a ticket to germany with spectacular and important long-range goals . it all adds up to a potentially thrilling game with the whiff of an upset curling around the fifa world cup stadium in munich . germany -lrb- 4-4-2 -rrb- : 1-jens lehmann ; 3-arne friedrich , 21-christoph metzelder , 17-per mertesacker , 16-phillip lahm ; 18-bernd schneider , 8-torsten frings , 13-michael ballack , 7-bastian schweinsteiger ; 20-lukas podolski , 11-miroslav klose costa rica -lrb- 3-5-2 -rrb- : 18-jose francisco porras ; 4-michael umana , 3-luis marin , 12-leonardo gonzalez ; 20-douglas sequeira , 5-gilberto martinez , 8-mauricio solis , 10-walter centeno , 6-danny fonseca ; 11-ronald gomez , 9-paulo wanchope nick amies send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de klinsmann : " we 're hungry for the opening game " german national soccer coach jürgen klinsmann said he ca n't wait for the world cup to begin after his team won their last pre-cup game against colombia 3-0 .
-lrb- june 3 , 2006 -rrb- world cup team checks : germany germany hosts the fifa 2006 world cup and has a rich championship pedigree .
playing at home is putting the team under increasing pressure to deliver a first title since 1990 .
world cup team checks : costa rica the costa ricans , with their flamboyant and often chaotic style , will be taking part in their third world cup in germany after negotiating the difficult concacaf qualifying zone .
audios and videos on the topic munich 's ready for kick-off pictures germany world cup squad www-links fifa world cup 2006 the official homepage of the 2006 fifa world cup in germany .

hosts plot costa rica 's downfall as world cup kicks off -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 29.03.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 hosts plot costa rica 's downfall as world cup kicks off großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : will germany still smile friday night ?
the waiting is over .
nearly six years after germany was awarded the 2006 world cup , the globe 's biggest soccer spectacle began in munich friday with the hosts playing costa rica in the first game . since that ecstatic night in zurich on july 6 , 2000 when franz beckenbauer 's glitzy team of soccer legends , celebrities and politicians won the right to stage the tournament , enough column inches have been written on germany 's preparations to stretch from berlin to san jose .
now the real action starts . germany remain confident that their first opponents will not spoil the opening party .
assistant coach joachim löw revealed earlier in the week that the staff and players had studied dvds of the central americans ' warm-up matches and that the belief was that the hosts would get their world cup campaign off to a winning start . " it is the first match and we are a bit nervous but we have done our homework and i think we are in a position to beat costa rica , " löw told reporters .
" if we turn up and show our strengths we will win the match . " germany manager jürgen klinsmann has forced all of his players to watch clips of their opponents and löw claims costa rica were no longer an unknown quantity . " we have collected a lot of information on them by watching dvd clips of league games and international matches , " said löw .
" we know their strengths and weaknesses but of course we will not be discussing them in public . " costa rica n culture , lifestyle as well as tactics studied bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany 's first game will be no san jose beach at sunset klinsmann seems to have left nothing to chance .
the coach has even had his stars studying costa rica 's culture and lifestyle for clues on how their opponents will play in the opening match .
the german team have been viewing a short film about the friendly central american country , famed for its diverse wildlife and the fact that it has no military forces . " we introduced the players to the country , how the people live there and what their mentality is like , " löw added .
" we 've also seen from games that they 're technically skilful and they love to play beautiful soccer .
that 's a reflection of the national character . " germany captain michael ballack , who will not be playing because of injuries , said everyone had enjoyed the lesson . " it was highly educational , " ballack said .
" we all loved hearing about costa rica and getting an insight into the culture . " while having as much knowledge as possible of their opponents will give the german team a sense of preparation , the real revelations will come on the pitch .
and the hosts will be wary of any surprises . coach kli n sma n n set to start with sta n dard formatio n klinsmann is likely to deploy a standard 4-4-2 formation to counter costa rica coach alexandre guimaraes 's promise that his team are going to abandon their nice guy approach and hit their opponents with a new aggressive form of their renowned free-flowing style . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ballack scored against colombia but will he start the first game ?
the defensive back four charged with repelling costa rican strikers alvaro saborio and paulo wanchope is expected to be the one which kept colombia at bay in the last test match : arne friedrich , per metesacker , christoph metzelder and philipp lahm , with new number one jens lehmann tending goal behind them . with ballack missing , the midfield will probably feature bernd schneider , torsten frings and bastian schweinsteiger .
the combative tim borowski is most likely to take ballack 's place while sebastian kehl is also on standby . responsible for getting germany 's first goals of the tournament will be striking partnership miroslav klose and lukas podolski . costa rica 's trai n er says his team is n o soft touch costa rica are unlikely to roll over for the hosts just to get the party started on an upbeat note .
coach guimaraes , who was also in charge four years ago in japan / korea , has returned after the unsuccessful tenure of the american steve sampson and has built a new-look team which are tougher and more mature than in the last world cup when they were considered a soft touch . " before , costa rica were a fair play team , naive and just interested in attacking , " he recently told reporters .
" this time , everybody 's going to notice the difference . "
bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : paulo wanchope still leads the line for costa rica costa rica 's world cup debut performance in italy in 1990 saw them reach the last 16 , shocking scotland and sweden on the way .
guimaraes is optimistic that his team can at least emulate that despite struggling through the qualifying rounds . their main threat will come from paulo wanchope , their all-time leading scorer with 43 goals including eight in the qualifiers .
despite losing some of his pace , the striker has a wealth of international experience garnered from a career spent in the english and spanish leagues . world cup experie n ce from back to fro n t the team 's spine consists of the other remaining members of the class of 2002 ; including defenders harold wallace , luis marin and gilberto martinez , midfield playmaker walter centeno and forward ronald gomez .
but while these players may be well-known , germany will have to be wary of the newcomers alvaro saborio and midfielder carlos hernandez whose inclusion helped turn a near-disastrous qualifying campaign into a ticket to germany with spectacular and important long-range goals . it all adds up to a potentially thrilling game with the whiff of an upset curling around the fifa world cup stadium in munich . germany -lrb- 4-4-2 -rrb- : 1-jens lehmann ; 3-arne friedrich , 21-christoph metzelder , 17-per mertesacker , 16-phillip lahm ; 18-bernd schneider , 8-torsten frings , 13-michael ballack , 7-bastian schweinsteiger ; 20-lukas podolski , 11-miroslav klose costa rica -lrb- 3-5-2 -rrb- : 18-jose francisco porras ; 4-michael umana , 3-luis marin , 12-leonardo gonzalez ; 20-douglas sequeira , 5-gilberto martinez , 8-mauricio solis , 10-walter centeno , 6-danny fonseca ; 11-ronald gomez , 9-paulo wanchope nick amies send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de klinsmann : " we 're hungry for the opening game " german national soccer coach jürgen klinsmann said he ca n't wait for the world cup to begin after his team won their last pre-cup game against colombia 3-0 .
-lrb- june 3 , 2006 -rrb- world cup team checks : germany germany hosts the fifa 2006 world cup and has a rich championship pedigree .
playing at home is putting the team under increasing pressure to deliver a first title since 1990 .
world cup team checks : costa rica the costa ricans , with their flamboyant and often chaotic style , will be taking part in their third world cup in germany after negotiating the difficult concacaf qualifying zone .
audios and videos on the topic munich 's ready for kick-off pictures germany world cup squad www-links fifa world cup 2006 the official homepage of the 2006 fifa world cup in germany .
