philipp lahm curls in a beauty left-back philipp lahm cuts in from the flank , drops his shoulder and fires a curling long range effort over porras into the far right hand corner .
a great opening goal ! 9. min .
germany are running riot over the costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over the costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
klose closes in on goal a lovely through ball from borowski almost gets klose in but porras rushes out of the goal to smother the shot and beat the ball away .
12. min .
goal costa rica 12. min .
wanchope beats the offside trap germany were left calling for offside but wanchope gathers the ball and sweeps it past lehmann .
17. min .
goal germany klose gathers a cut back from scweinsteiger to sweep germany back into the lead ! 18. min .
great work from germany for the goal bernd schneider laid a lovely ball back from the right flank to catch schweinsteiger 's run into the box and the clever ball to klose left the striker with the easy task to knock in germany 's second .
20. min .
podolski fires in a rocket lukas podolski looks to increase the lead by rifling in a 20 meter shot which porras fails to hold at the first attempt .
he gathers at the second and the danger passes .
24. min .
despite being two-one down , the costa ricans are battling hard .
germany are faster on the break and looking dangerous but the hosts are having to defend staunchly as costa rica continue to threaten .
27. min .
again schweinsteiger is played in by schneider .
the winger dances past one challenge and threads a ball to borowski in the box .
his shot is blocked at the last minute .
29. min .
danny fonseca gets the first card 29. min .
costa rica 's midfielder gets booked for a harsh challenge on borowski .
35. min .
costa rica try and beat the offside trap again as they did on their first goal but this time the flag rules against the attempt on goal .
41. min .
schweinsteiger whips in a low corner from the right which evades everyone except christoph metzelder at the far post .
he waves a boot at the ball and it balloons over the bar .
an attacker in the same position may have made it 3-1 .
45. min .
half-time sounds with germany out on top half-time : germany go into the break in control of the game by way of goals , possession and chances .
costa rica look to have run out of ideas but there is still a whiff of danger in their attacks .
there could well be more goals in this game for both sides .
45. min .
second half : germany kick off the second half gets underway with germany leading costa rica 2-1 .
the host nation look to capitalize on their showing at the end of the first period and sew the game up .
costa rica will be looking for a way back into the match .
45. min .
germany start by firing in a rising shot from tom borowski just over the bar within seconds of the restart .
50. min .
germany continue to push forward and are frustrating the costa ricans .
a chipped cross from schneider is headed just wide by borowski .
55. min .
klinsmann gets david odonkor and oliver neuville warming up on the sidelines as he considers his options .
concentration seems to be slipping with some of the germany players and they have been forced into mistakes by the costa ricans in the past five minutes .
60. min .
goal germany 60. min .
klose follows up to make it 3-1 lahm sends over an out-swinging cross which klose heads goalwards .
porras saves but klose follows up and lifts the ball over the keeper and into the roof of the net .
65. min .
germany are coasting now with a two-goal cushion but look to score more goals and kill the game off .
paulo wanchope is a lone figure as costa rica gets everyone behind the ball .
67. min .
costa rica bring on jarvis drummond for gilberto martinez .
69. min .
philipp lahm is having an enjoyable afternoon on the left flank .
the left back races past two defenders on the wing , cuts inside before bearing down on goal .
he tries to poke the ball under porras but gets no power and the keeper saves easily .
71. min .
sebastian kehl enters the fray klinsmann takes off the hard-working borowski for sebastian kehl to freshen the midfield .
72. min .
goal costa rica 72. min .
wanchope gets his second paulo wanchope gets his and costa rica 's second as confusion reigns in the german defense .
wanchope slips through the two central defenders to recieve a lofted ball and hesitates slightly before stroking the ball past jens lehmann who stays rooted to the spot .
78. min .
costa rica substitution mauricio solis comes off for bolanos as costa rica look to stage a shocking comeback .
78. min .
two-goal klose comes off oliver neuville comes on for germany 's two-goal hero miro klose .
80. min .
germany want the game won and per mertesacker thumps a header straight at porras as the hosts search for a way to kill off the resurgent costa ricans .
85. min .
schneider loses position in the box and is lucky not get booked for the dive that follows .
the advantage is played to costa rica and the counter-attack begins .
86. min .
goal germany 86. min .
frings lets rip from 40 meters !
an absolute rocket from torsten frings puts the game beyond costa rica 's reach with a monster shot which flie into the top right hand corner from 40 meters out .
schweinsteiger played the ball square into the midfielder 's path and he hit it on the run .
90. min .
germany substitution david odonkor comes on for bernd schneider 90. min .
costa rica substitution azofeifa comes on for gomez .
90 + 3. min .
germany win the opening game the whistle goes and germany wins the match 4-2 and starts the 2006 world cup in style . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

live ticker : germany 4:2 costa rica -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 26.09.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 live ticker : germany 4:2 costa rica review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . welcome to the world cup kick-off ! !
the wait is over .
germany , the host nation , finally makes good on all the promises and delivers the globe 's most prestigious soccer event to the world .
the fifa world cup stadium münchen plays host to the opening game between jürgen klinsmann 's germany and central american hopefuls costa rica .
stay tuned for all the action as the world cup action unfolds here with dw-world.de 's live ticker less than 45 minutes to go !
the capacity crowd in the fifa world cup stadium münchen has already enjoyed a spectacular opening ceremony with traditional bavarian dancers and a host of international stars .
stars from the history of the world cup have also been paraded in front of the expectant fans as the clock ticks down to kick-off team line-ups announced the teams have been announced and there is no place in the germany team for the injured michael ballack .
tim borowski takes his place in midfield and bernd schneider takes over the captaincy .
germany : lehmann jens , friedrich arne , schweinsteiger bastian , frings torsten , klose miroslav , lahm philipp , mertesacker per , borowski tim , schneider bernd -lrb- c -rrb- , podolski lukas , metzelder christoph costa rica : porras jose -lrb- c -rrb- , marin luis , umana michael , martinez gilberto , fonseca danny , solis mauricio , wanchope paulo , centeno walter , gomez ronald , gonzalez leonardo , sequeira douglas klinsmann sticks with winning line-up germany coach jürgen klinsmann has gone with the same team - minus ballack - who dispensed with costa rica 's central american counterparts colombia 3-0 in germany 's last test game with lehmann in goal , the back four remains arne friedrich , philipp lahm , per mertesacker and christoph metzelder .
the midfield consists of schweinsteiger , frings , schneider and borowski while lukas podolski and miroslav klose start up front .
the crowd awaits the teams the german and costa rican teams are lining up in the bowels of the stadium , ready to exit to what is expected to be a deafening reception in munich as they prepare to get the 2006 fifa world cup underway .
the stadium is a sea of colors and a cauldron of song as the flags of the teams are brought out onto the pitch precipitating the arrival of the teams .
the teams exit to rapturous applause germany and costa rica come out onto the prestine pitch as the world cup gets ready to get underway .
the costa rican national anthem sounds out with enthusiastic singing from the team and their supporters .
the german anthem is belted out by the host team and the fans respectfully join in .
it is a more solemn chorus than the preceding anthem but one of pride as germany prepares to host the greatest soccer show on earth .
1. min .
the 2006 world cup gets underway costa rica kicks off to begin the first game in the 2006 fifa world cup .
1. min .
an early surge through the midfield from costa rica results in the first free kick .
1. min .
the free kick is chipped inot the far post but its too long for the striker centeno .
2. min .
germany get their first chance to build an attack on the left flank with schweinsteiger and lahm working well .
a hard tackle from marin ends their progress .
2. min .
frings long range effort flies just over germany build from the midfield and the ball falls to frings who rifles in a dipping long range shot which just flies over .
6. min .
goal germany ! ! 6. min .
philipp lahm curls in a beauty left-back philipp lahm cuts in from the flank , drops his shoulder and fires a curling long range effort over porras into the far right hand corner .
a great opening goal ! 9. min .
germany are running riot over the costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over the costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
germany are running riot over costa rica with schweinsteiger and lahm ripping the left hand side to pieces .
9. min .
klose closes in on goal a lovely through ball from borowski almost gets klose in but porras rushes out of the goal to smother the shot and beat the ball away .
12. min .
goal costa rica 12. min .
wanchope beats the offside trap germany were left calling for offside but wanchope gathers the ball and sweeps it past lehmann .
17. min .
goal germany klose gathers a cut back from scweinsteiger to sweep germany back into the lead ! 18. min .
great work from germany for the goal bernd schneider laid a lovely ball back from the right flank to catch schweinsteiger 's run into the box and the clever ball to klose left the striker with the easy task to knock in germany 's second .
20. min .
podolski fires in a rocket lukas podolski looks to increase the lead by rifling in a 20 meter shot which porras fails to hold at the first attempt .
he gathers at the second and the danger passes .
24. min .
despite being two-one down , the costa ricans are battling hard .
germany are faster on the break and looking dangerous but the hosts are having to defend staunchly as costa rica continue to threaten .
27. min .
again schweinsteiger is played in by schneider .
the winger dances past one challenge and threads a ball to borowski in the box .
his shot is blocked at the last minute .
29. min .
danny fonseca gets the first card 29. min .
costa rica 's midfielder gets booked for a harsh challenge on borowski .
35. min .
costa rica try and beat the offside trap again as they did on their first goal but this time the flag rules against the attempt on goal .
41. min .
schweinsteiger whips in a low corner from the right which evades everyone except christoph metzelder at the far post .
he waves a boot at the ball and it balloons over the bar .
an attacker in the same position may have made it 3-1 .
45. min .
half-time sounds with germany out on top half-time : germany go into the break in control of the game by way of goals , possession and chances .

there could well be more goals in this game for both sides .
45. min .

the host nation look to capitalize on their showing at the end of the first period and sew the game up .
costa rica will be looking for a way back into the match .

pro-serbian author turns down disputed german prize -pipe- culture & lifestyle -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 09.12.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle art & architecture sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de culture & lifestyle -pipe- 09.06.2006 pro-serbian author turns down disputed german prize großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : rejecting the heine prize , handke wanted so spare everybody from further embarrassment austrian writer peter handke , often criticized for his pro-serbian stance during the balkan wars , turned down germany 's heine prize , after politicians in the city of düsseldorf threatened to revoke the award . peter handke , the austrian author accused of serbian nationalist sympathies , turned down a german literature prize on thursday before politicians could revoke it . handke said in a letter to the mayor of düsseldorf , joachim erwin , that he would not accept the western german city 's heinrich heine award to save everybody involved from further embarrassment . " i am writing to you to spare you and the world from the upcoming sitting of the city council in which they will decide not to give me the prize , " handke said in the letter .
" also to spare myself ... and above all to spare my work , which i do not want to become an endless target for the vulgar insults of party politicians . " he suggested that the council meeting be cancelled and its members sent into nature to breathe fresh air , " for example to have a picnic on the banks of the rhine . " an ongoing controversy bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : she stood up for her fellow countryman : austrian author and nobel prize winner jelinek handke was named winner of the prize last month , but the düsseldorf city council said last week that it would veto the jury 's decision because of his eulogy for former yugoslav president and alleged war criminal slobodan milosevic . the writer attended milosevic 's funeral in march and lauded him as " a man who defended his people . " the speech also sparked a bitter row in france with the administrator of the paris state theater comedie francaise , marcel bozonnet , canceling the 2007 season of handke 's play " voyage to the sonorous land or the art of asking . " bozonnet 's decision was condemned in art circles in france , where handke lives , and further afield as censorship .
the critics included his german publishers , suhrkamp , and his compatriot , nobel literature laureate elfriede jelinek . handke said he was " disgusted " by the decision and defended himself as merely having sought to counter the dominant , one-sided " polemic " view of the break-up of the former yugoslavia . a sense of deja-vu bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : handke 's plays are performed all over the world , but no longer at comedie francaise but when it was announced he should receive the heinrich heine prize , the same debate about whether an artist 's work can be separated from his political views resurged in germany .
local politicians said honoring handke was a slap in the face of those who suffered under milosevic and vowed to deny him the prize , which was due to be awarded on dec .
13 . the winner is chosen by an independent panel , but must be confirmed by düsseldorf authorities who donate the prize money of 50,000 euros -lrb- $ 63,300 -rrb- . dw staff / afp -lrb- tt -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans divided over prize for pro-serb author handke the decision to award the city of düsseldorf 's prestigious heine prize to controversial austrian author peter handke - known for his pro-serbian stance during the balkan wars - has been met with criticism in germany .
-lrb- may 29 , 2006 -rrb- opinion : a truly idiotic decision by declaring themselves ready to revoke the decision of an independent literary jury , german politicians are embarrassing themselves and damaging the fundaments of democratic culture , says dw-world.de 's toma tasovac .
german politicians to block prize for milosevic sympathizer local politicians in düsseldorf are likely to block plans to award the prestigious heinrich heine prize to austrian writer peter handke , who has been criticized for his support of late serb leader slobodan milosevic .
-lrb- may 31 , 2006 -rrb- feedback should the city of düsseldorf officially revoke the heine prize from handke despite his rejection of the disputed award ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

pro-serbian author turns down disputed german prize -pipe- culture & lifestyle -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 01.05.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle music art & architecture sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de culture & lifestyle -pipe- 09.06.2006 pro-serbian author turns down disputed german prize großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : rejecting the heine prize , handke wanted so spare everybody from further embarrassment austrian writer peter handke , often criticized for his pro-serbian stance during the balkan wars , turned down germany 's heine prize , after politicians in the city of düsseldorf threatened to revoke the award . peter handke , the austrian author accused of serbian nationalist sympathies , turned down a german literature prize on thursday before politicians could revoke it . handke said in a letter to the mayor of düsseldorf , joachim erwin , that he would not accept the western german city 's heinrich heine award to save everybody involved from further embarrassment . " i am writing to you to spare you and the world from the upcoming sitting of the city council in which they will decide not to give me the prize , " handke said in the letter .
" also to spare myself ... and above all to spare my work , which i do not want to become an endless target for the vulgar insults of party politicians . " he suggested that the council meeting be cancelled and its members sent into nature to breathe fresh air , " for example to have a picnic on the banks of the rhine . " an ongoing controversy bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : she stood up for her fellow countryman : austrian author and nobel prize winner jelinek handke was named winner of the prize last month , but the düsseldorf city council said last week that it would veto the jury 's decision because of his eulogy for former yugoslav president and alleged war criminal slobodan milosevic . the writer attended milosevic 's funeral in march and lauded him as " a man who defended his people . " the speech also sparked a bitter row in france with the administrator of the paris state theater comedie francaise , marcel bozonnet , canceling the 2007 season of handke 's play " voyage to the sonorous land or the art of asking . " bozonnet 's decision was condemned in art circles in france , where handke lives , and further afield as censorship .
the critics included his german publishers , suhrkamp , and his compatriot , nobel literature laureate elfriede jelinek . handke said he was " disgusted " by the decision and defended himself as merely having sought to counter the dominant , one-sided " polemic " view of the break-up of the former yugoslavia . a sense of deja-vu bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : handke 's plays are performed all over the world , but no longer at comedie francaise but when it was announced he should receive the heinrich heine prize , the same debate about whether an artist 's work can be separated from his political views resurged in germany .
local politicians said honoring handke was a slap in the face of those who suffered under milosevic and vowed to deny him the prize , which was due to be awarded on dec .
13 . the winner is chosen by an independent panel , but must be confirmed by düsseldorf authorities who donate the prize money of 50,000 euros -lrb- $ 63,300 -rrb- . dw staff / afp -lrb- tt -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans divided over prize for pro-serb author handke the decision to award the city of düsseldorf 's prestigious heine prize to controversial austrian author peter handke - known for his pro-serbian stance during the balkan wars - has been met with criticism in germany .
-lrb- may 29 , 2006 -rrb- opinion : a truly idiotic decision by declaring themselves ready to revoke the decision of an independent literary jury , german politicians are embarrassing themselves and damaging the fundaments of democratic culture , says dw-world.de 's toma tasovac .
german politicians to block prize for milosevic sympathizer local politicians in düsseldorf are likely to block plans to award the prestigious heinrich heine prize to austrian writer peter handke , who has been criticized for his support of late serb leader slobodan milosevic .
-lrb- may 31 , 2006 -rrb- feedback should the city of düsseldorf officially revoke the heine prize from handke despite his rejection of the disputed award ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

pro-serbian author turns down disputed german prize -pipe- culture & lifestyle -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 28.03.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle art & architecture sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de culture & lifestyle -pipe- 09.06.2006 pro-serbian author turns down disputed german prize großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : rejecting the heine prize , handke wanted so spare everybody from further embarrassment austrian writer peter handke , often criticized for his pro-serbian stance during the balkan wars , turned down germany 's heine prize , after politicians in the city of düsseldorf threatened to revoke the award . peter handke , the austrian author accused of serbian nationalist sympathies , turned down a german literature prize on thursday before politicians could revoke it . handke said in a letter to the mayor of düsseldorf , joachim erwin , that he would not accept the western german city 's heinrich heine award to save everybody involved from further embarrassment . " i am writing to you to spare you and the world from the upcoming sitting of the city council in which they will decide not to give me the prize , " handke said in the letter .
" also to spare myself ... and above all to spare my work , which i do not want to become an endless target for the vulgar insults of party politicians . " he suggested that the council meeting be cancelled and its members sent into nature to breathe fresh air , " for example to have a picnic on the banks of the rhine . " an ongoing controversy bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : she stood up for her fellow countryman : austrian author and nobel prize winner jelinek handke was named winner of the prize last month , but the düsseldorf city council said last week that it would veto the jury 's decision because of his eulogy for former yugoslav president and alleged war criminal slobodan milosevic . the writer attended milosevic 's funeral in march and lauded him as " a man who defended his people . " the speech also sparked a bitter row in france with the administrator of the paris state theater comedie francaise , marcel bozonnet , canceling the 2007 season of handke 's play " voyage to the sonorous land or the art of asking . " bozonnet 's decision was condemned in art circles in france , where handke lives , and further afield as censorship .
the critics included his german publishers , suhrkamp , and his compatriot , nobel literature laureate elfriede jelinek . handke said he was " disgusted " by the decision and defended himself as merely having sought to counter the dominant , one-sided " polemic " view of the break-up of the former yugoslavia . a sense of deja-vu bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : handke 's plays are performed all over the world , but no longer at comedie francaise but when it was announced he should receive the heinrich heine prize , the same debate about whether an artist 's work can be separated from his political views resurged in germany .
local politicians said honoring handke was a slap in the face of those who suffered under milosevic and vowed to deny him the prize , which was due to be awarded on dec .
13 . the winner is chosen by an independent panel , but must be confirmed by düsseldorf authorities who donate the prize money of 50,000 euros -lrb- $ 63,300 -rrb- . dw staff / afp -lrb- tt -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germans divided over prize for pro-serb author handke the decision to award the city of düsseldorf 's prestigious heine prize to controversial austrian author peter handke - known for his pro-serbian stance during the balkan wars - has been met with criticism in germany .
-lrb- may 29 , 2006 -rrb- opinion : a truly idiotic decision by declaring themselves ready to revoke the decision of an independent literary jury , german politicians are embarrassing themselves and damaging the fundaments of democratic culture , says dw-world.de 's toma tasovac .
german politicians to block prize for milosevic sympathizer local politicians in düsseldorf are likely to block plans to award the prestigious heinrich heine prize to austrian writer peter handke , who has been criticized for his support of late serb leader slobodan milosevic .
-lrb- may 31 , 2006 -rrb- feedback should the city of düsseldorf officially revoke the heine prize from handke despite his rejection of the disputed award ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

washington wants german troops in iraq -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 06.11.2010 home news germany german reunification europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 09.06.2006 washington wants german troops in iraq großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : donald rumsfeld feels the us needs german support in iraq us defense secretary donald rumsfeld is putting germany under increasing pressure to send troops to iraq , say german media reports . according to the daily berliner zeitung , rumsfeld called on his german counterpart franz josef jung to deploy bundeswehr soldiers in training iraqi forces in baghdad .
the request apparently came shortly after the german elections last autumn , with washington hoping that the new government might do a u-turn from the social democratic-green party coalition 's staunch resistance to the military invasion . but chancellor angela merkel has adhered to the same policy upheld by her predecessor , gerhard schröder , who categorically rejected involvement in the us-led military presence in iraq . german newspapers allege that in government circles , sending troops to the country , even in a training capacity , is seen as the thin end of the wedge . " if we gave them an inch , they would take a mile , " the berliner zeitung quoted one source as saying . germany stays firm bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr plays a role in the conflict , but the us wants more speaking after a meeting of nato defense ministers in brussels thursday , jung stressed that despite repeated urging from washington , germany would not be sending the bundeswehr to iraq . in 2004 , nato agreed to a training mission which has so far seen 1,000 iraqi officers trained in the iraqi capital and a further 500 in europe , including at the bundeswehr 's military academy in hamburg .
german soldiers are also training iraqis in the united arab emirates . " germany is contributing to stabilizing the iraqi forces , " emphasized jung in brussels , but reiterated that deploying troops inside the country remained out of the question . modern-day challenges at the meeting , nato defense ministers approved new guidelines to adapt the military alliance to modern-day challenges and provide for the deployment of hundreds of thousands of troops , a spokesman said . the move comes as the alliance is increasingly called upon to conduct missions unlike the purely military operations it has run in the past , like moving aid into quake-hit pakistan or providing training . " nato has gone through very fundamental changes in terms of what it has done and what it is doing , and this will bring the force planning into line with the realities of the 21st century , " said spokesman james appathurai . simultaneous missions bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr is increasingly deployed for disaster relief , such as in pakistan in 2005 the so-called " ministerial guidance " will prepare nato to conduct simultaneously two large missions , involving some 60,000 troops , and six smaller ones , comprising up to 30,000 soldiers each . " we no longer need to prepare for one big war .
we have to prepare for , and indeed carry out , a multitude of military operations , " appathurai said . the document will guide the 26 members of the alliance in ways to prepare for nato 's new operations and work with other bodies like the un , the eu and non-governmental organizations . the spokesman said that the allies had also committed " to endeavor " to boost their military spending to two percent of gross domestic product ; a level only achieved currently by seven states . dw staff / afp -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de opinion : troops are n't answer in afghanistan the bundestag extended the german 's army 's mandate in afghanistan in a clear vote on wednesday , but deutsche welle 's nina werkhäuser says more soldiers wo n't solve the country 's problems .
-lrb- sept .
28 , 2005 -rrb- merkel prepared to send troops to congo , reports say according to german newspaper reports , chancellor angela merkel is willing to send troops to the democratic republic of congo to help with planned elections in the war-ravaged country .
-lrb- feb .
11 , 2006 -rrb- as germany 's role changes , so does military the german defense minister is expected this week to announce the closure of 105 bundeswehr bases .
though the new german military might not need them , local residents are nervous .
-lrb- nov .
1 , 2004 -rrb- feedback should germany send troops to iraq ?
send us an e-mail , and please include your name and country in your reply .

" if we gave them an inch , they would take a mile , " the berliner zeitung quoted one source as saying . germany stays firm bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr plays a role in the conflict , but the us wants more speaking after a meeting of nato defense ministers in brussels thursday , jung stressed that despite repeated urging from washington , germany would not be sending the bundeswehr to iraq . in 2004 , nato agreed to a training mission which has so far seen 1,000 iraqi officers trained in the iraqi capital and a further 500 in europe , including at the bundeswehr 's military academy in hamburg .
german soldiers are also training iraqis in the united arab emirates . " germany is contributing to stabilizing the iraqi forces , " emphasized jung in brussels , but reiterated that deploying troops inside the country remained out of the question . modern-day challenges at the meeting , nato defense ministers approved new guidelines to adapt the military alliance to modern-day challenges and provide for the deployment of hundreds of thousands of troops , a spokesman said . the move comes as the alliance is increasingly called upon to conduct missions unlike the purely military operations it has run in the past , like moving aid into quake-hit pakistan or providing training . " nato has gone through very fundamental changes in terms of what it has done and what it is doing , and this will bring the force planning into line with the realities of the 21st century , " said spokesman james appathurai . simultaneous missions bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr is increasingly deployed for disaster relief , such as in pakistan in 2005 the so-called " ministerial guidance " will prepare nato to conduct simultaneously two large missions , involving some 60,000 troops , and six smaller ones , comprising up to 30,000 soldiers each . " we no longer need to prepare for one big war .
we have to prepare for , and indeed carry out , a multitude of military operations , " appathurai said . the document will guide the 26 members of the alliance in ways to prepare for nato 's new operations and work with other bodies like the un , the eu and non-governmental organizations . the spokesman said that the allies had also committed " to endeavor " to boost their military spending to two percent of gross domestic product ; a level only achieved currently by seven states . dw staff / afp -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de opinion : troops are n't answer in afghanistan the bundestag extended the german 's army 's mandate in afghanistan in a clear vote on wednesday , but deutsche welle 's nina werkhäuser says more soldiers wo n't solve the country 's problems .

28 , 2005 -rrb- merkel prepared to send troops to congo , reports say according to german newspaper reports , chancellor angela merkel is willing to send troops to the democratic republic of congo to help with planned elections in the war-ravaged country .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 09.06.2006 washington wants german troops in iraq großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : donald rumsfeld feels the us needs german support in iraq us defense secretary donald rumsfeld is putting germany under increasing pressure to send troops to iraq , say german media reports . according to the daily berliner zeitung , rumsfeld called on his german counterpart franz josef jung to deploy bundeswehr soldiers in training iraqi forces in baghdad .
the request apparently came shortly after the german elections last autumn , with washington hoping that the new government might do a u-turn from the social democratic-green party coalition 's staunch resistance to the military invasion . but chancellor angela merkel has adhered to the same policy upheld by her predecessor , gerhard schröder , who categorically rejected involvement in the us-led military presence in iraq . german newspapers allege that in government circles , sending troops to the country , even in a training capacity , is seen as the thin end of the wedge . " if we gave them an inch , they would take a mile , " the berliner zeitung quoted one source as saying . germany stays firm bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr plays a role in the conflict , but the us wants more speaking after a meeting of nato defense ministers in brussels thursday , jung stressed that despite repeated urging from washington , germany would not be sending the bundeswehr to iraq . in 2004 , nato agreed to a training mission which has so far seen 1,000 iraqi officers trained in the iraqi capital and a further 500 in europe , including at the bundeswehr 's military academy in hamburg .
german soldiers are also training iraqis in the united arab emirates . " germany is contributing to stabilizing the iraqi forces , " emphasized jung in brussels , but reiterated that deploying troops inside the country remained out of the question . modern-day challenges at the meeting , nato defense ministers approved new guidelines to adapt the military alliance to modern-day challenges and provide for the deployment of hundreds of thousands of troops , a spokesman said . the move comes as the alliance is increasingly called upon to conduct missions unlike the purely military operations it has run in the past , like moving aid into quake-hit pakistan or providing training . " nato has gone through very fundamental changes in terms of what it has done and what it is doing , and this will bring the force planning into line with the realities of the 21st century , " said spokesman james appathurai . simultaneous missions bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr is increasingly deployed for disaster relief , such as in pakistan in 2005 the so-called " ministerial guidance " will prepare nato to conduct simultaneously two large missions , involving some 60,000 troops , and six smaller ones , comprising up to 30,000 soldiers each . " we no longer need to prepare for one big war .
we have to prepare for , and indeed carry out , a multitude of military operations , " appathurai said . the document will guide the 26 members of the alliance in ways to prepare for nato 's new operations and work with other bodies like the un , the eu and non-governmental organizations . the spokesman said that the allies had also committed " to endeavor " to boost their military spending to two percent of gross domestic product ; a level only achieved currently by seven states . dw staff / afp -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de opinion : troops are n't answer in afghanistan the bundestag extended the german 's army 's mandate in afghanistan in a clear vote on wednesday , but deutsche welle 's nina werkhäuser says more soldiers wo n't solve the country 's problems .
-lrb- sept .
28 , 2005 -rrb- merkel prepared to send troops to congo , reports say according to german newspaper reports , chancellor angela merkel is willing to send troops to the democratic republic of congo to help with planned elections in the war-ravaged country .
-lrb- feb .
11 , 2006 -rrb- as germany 's role changes , so does military the german defense minister is expected this week to announce the closure of 105 bundeswehr bases .
though the new german military might not need them , local residents are nervous .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 09.06.2006 washington wants german troops in iraq großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : donald rumsfeld feels the us needs german support in iraq us defense secretary donald rumsfeld is putting germany under increasing pressure to send troops to iraq , say german media reports . according to the daily berliner zeitung , rumsfeld called on his german counterpart franz josef jung to deploy bundeswehr soldiers in training iraqi forces in baghdad .
the request apparently came shortly after the german elections last autumn , with washington hoping that the new government might do a u-turn from the social democratic-green party coalition 's staunch resistance to the military invasion . but chancellor angela merkel has adhered to the same policy upheld by her predecessor , gerhard schröder , who categorically rejected involvement in the us-led military presence in iraq . german newspapers allege that in government circles , sending troops to the country , even in a training capacity , is seen as the thin end of the wedge . " if we gave them an inch , they would take a mile , " the berliner zeitung quoted one source as saying . germany stays firm bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr plays a role in the conflict , but the us wants more speaking after a meeting of nato defense ministers in brussels thursday , jung stressed that despite repeated urging from washington , germany would not be sending the bundeswehr to iraq . in 2004 , nato agreed to a training mission which has so far seen 1,000 iraqi officers trained in the iraqi capital and a further 500 in europe , including at the bundeswehr 's military academy in hamburg .
german soldiers are also training iraqis in the united arab emirates . " germany is contributing to stabilizing the iraqi forces , " emphasized jung in brussels , but reiterated that deploying troops inside the country remained out of the question . modern-day challenges at the meeting , nato defense ministers approved new guidelines to adapt the military alliance to modern-day challenges and provide for the deployment of hundreds of thousands of troops , a spokesman said . the move comes as the alliance is increasingly called upon to conduct missions unlike the purely military operations it has run in the past , like moving aid into quake-hit pakistan or providing training . " nato has gone through very fundamental changes in terms of what it has done and what it is doing , and this will bring the force planning into line with the realities of the 21st century , " said spokesman james appathurai . simultaneous missions bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr is increasingly deployed for disaster relief , such as in pakistan in 2005 the so-called " ministerial guidance " will prepare nato to conduct simultaneously two large missions , involving some 60,000 troops , and six smaller ones , comprising up to 30,000 soldiers each . " we no longer need to prepare for one big war .
we have to prepare for , and indeed carry out , a multitude of military operations , " appathurai said . the document will guide the 26 members of the alliance in ways to prepare for nato 's new operations and work with other bodies like the un , the eu and non-governmental organizations . the spokesman said that the allies had also committed " to endeavor " to boost their military spending to two percent of gross domestic product ; a level only achieved currently by seven states . dw staff / afp -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de opinion : troops are n't answer in afghanistan the bundestag extended the german 's army 's mandate in afghanistan in a clear vote on wednesday , but deutsche welle 's nina werkhäuser says more soldiers wo n't solve the country 's problems .
-lrb- sept .
28 , 2005 -rrb- merkel prepared to send troops to congo , reports say according to german newspaper reports , chancellor angela merkel is willing to send troops to the democratic republic of congo to help with planned elections in the war-ravaged country .
-lrb- feb .
11 , 2006 -rrb- as germany 's role changes , so does military the german defense minister is expected this week to announce the closure of 105 bundeswehr bases .
though the new german military might not need them , local residents are nervous .
-lrb- nov .
1 , 2004 -rrb- feedback should germany send troops to iraq ?
send us an e-mail , and please include your name and country in your reply .

washington wants german troops in iraq -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 03.05.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 09.06.2006 washington wants german troops in iraq großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : donald rumsfeld feels the us needs german support in iraq us defense secretary donald rumsfeld is putting germany under increasing pressure to send troops to iraq , say german media reports . according to the daily berliner zeitung , rumsfeld called on his german counterpart franz josef jung to deploy bundeswehr soldiers in training iraqi forces in baghdad .
the request apparently came shortly after the german elections last autumn , with washington hoping that the new government might do a u-turn from the social democratic-green party coalition 's staunch resistance to the military invasion . but chancellor angela merkel has adhered to the same policy upheld by her predecessor , gerhard schröder , who categorically rejected involvement in the us-led military presence in iraq . german newspapers allege that in government circles , sending troops to the country , even in a training capacity , is seen as the thin end of the wedge . " if we gave them an inch , they would take a mile , " the berliner zeitung quoted one source as saying . germany stays firm bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr plays a role in the conflict , but the us wants more speaking after a meeting of nato defense ministers in brussels thursday , jung stressed that despite repeated urging from washington , germany would not be sending the bundeswehr to iraq . in 2004 , nato agreed to a training mission which has so far seen 1,000 iraqi officers trained in the iraqi capital and a further 500 in europe , including at the bundeswehr 's military academy in hamburg .
german soldiers are also training iraqis in the united arab emirates . " germany is contributing to stabilizing the iraqi forces , " emphasized jung in brussels , but reiterated that deploying troops inside the country remained out of the question . modern-day challenges at the meeting , nato defense ministers approved new guidelines to adapt the military alliance to modern-day challenges and provide for the deployment of hundreds of thousands of troops , a spokesman said . the move comes as the alliance is increasingly called upon to conduct missions unlike the purely military operations it has run in the past , like moving aid into quake-hit pakistan or providing training . " nato has gone through very fundamental changes in terms of what it has done and what it is doing , and this will bring the force planning into line with the realities of the 21st century , " said spokesman james appathurai . simultaneous missions bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr is increasingly deployed for disaster relief , such as in pakistan in 2005 the so-called " ministerial guidance " will prepare nato to conduct simultaneously two large missions , involving some 60,000 troops , and six smaller ones , comprising up to 30,000 soldiers each . " we no longer need to prepare for one big war .
we have to prepare for , and indeed carry out , a multitude of military operations , " appathurai said . the document will guide the 26 members of the alliance in ways to prepare for nato 's new operations and work with other bodies like the un , the eu and non-governmental organizations . the spokesman said that the allies had also committed " to endeavor " to boost their military spending to two percent of gross domestic product ; a level only achieved currently by seven states . dw staff / afp -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de opinion : troops are n't answer in afghanistan the bundestag extended the german 's army 's mandate in afghanistan in a clear vote on wednesday , but deutsche welle 's nina werkhäuser says more soldiers wo n't solve the country 's problems .
-lrb- sept .
28 , 2005 -rrb- merkel prepared to send troops to congo , reports say according to german newspaper reports , chancellor angela merkel is willing to send troops to the democratic republic of congo to help with planned elections in the war-ravaged country .
-lrb- feb .
11 , 2006 -rrb- as germany 's role changes , so does military the german defense minister is expected this week to announce the closure of 105 bundeswehr bases .
though the new german military might not need them , local residents are nervous .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 09.06.2006 washington wants german troops in iraq großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : donald rumsfeld feels the us needs german support in iraq us defense secretary donald rumsfeld is putting germany under increasing pressure to send troops to iraq , say german media reports . according to the daily berliner zeitung , rumsfeld called on his german counterpart franz josef jung to deploy bundeswehr soldiers in training iraqi forces in baghdad .
the request apparently came shortly after the german elections last autumn , with washington hoping that the new government might do a u-turn from the social democratic-green party coalition 's staunch resistance to the military invasion . but chancellor angela merkel has adhered to the same policy upheld by her predecessor , gerhard schröder , who categorically rejected involvement in the us-led military presence in iraq . german newspapers allege that in government circles , sending troops to the country , even in a training capacity , is seen as the thin end of the wedge . " if we gave them an inch , they would take a mile , " the berliner zeitung quoted one source as saying . germany stays firm bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr plays a role in the conflict , but the us wants more speaking after a meeting of nato defense ministers in brussels thursday , jung stressed that despite repeated urging from washington , germany would not be sending the bundeswehr to iraq . in 2004 , nato agreed to a training mission which has so far seen 1,000 iraqi officers trained in the iraqi capital and a further 500 in europe , including at the bundeswehr 's military academy in hamburg .
german soldiers are also training iraqis in the united arab emirates . " germany is contributing to stabilizing the iraqi forces , " emphasized jung in brussels , but reiterated that deploying troops inside the country remained out of the question . modern-day challenges at the meeting , nato defense ministers approved new guidelines to adapt the military alliance to modern-day challenges and provide for the deployment of hundreds of thousands of troops , a spokesman said . the move comes as the alliance is increasingly called upon to conduct missions unlike the purely military operations it has run in the past , like moving aid into quake-hit pakistan or providing training . " nato has gone through very fundamental changes in terms of what it has done and what it is doing , and this will bring the force planning into line with the realities of the 21st century , " said spokesman james appathurai . simultaneous missions bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the bundeswehr is increasingly deployed for disaster relief , such as in pakistan in 2005 the so-called " ministerial guidance " will prepare nato to conduct simultaneously two large missions , involving some 60,000 troops , and six smaller ones , comprising up to 30,000 soldiers each . " we no longer need to prepare for one big war .
we have to prepare for , and indeed carry out , a multitude of military operations , " appathurai said . the document will guide the 26 members of the alliance in ways to prepare for nato 's new operations and work with other bodies like the un , the eu and non-governmental organizations . the spokesman said that the allies had also committed " to endeavor " to boost their military spending to two percent of gross domestic product ; a level only achieved currently by seven states . dw staff / afp -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de opinion : troops are n't answer in afghanistan the bundestag extended the german 's army 's mandate in afghanistan in a clear vote on wednesday , but deutsche welle 's nina werkhäuser says more soldiers wo n't solve the country 's problems .

south american surprise puts ecuador even with germany -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 25.09.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 south american surprise puts ecuador even with germany großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ecuador 's edison mendez , right , congratulates teammate agustin delgado the 2006 world cup did n't take long to deliver it 's first surprise result .
ecuador shutout a favored poland side in gelsenkirchen friday night and took a big step toward moving into the next round . stuck in a group with the host nation , both poland and ecuador knew a win in their opening game would be crucial to their world cup campaign and were aiming for three points before suffering though a match against home favorite germany . carlos tenorio broke the deadlock in the 24th minute with a stooping header and agustin delgado made the points safe for the south americans with a simple tap-in 10 minutes from time . a long throw-in from the right touchline was flicked on by the gangly delgado and tenerio 's angled header just eluded poland keeper artur boruc 's outstretched hand for his sixth goal in 30 international appearances . ecuador killed off the contest in the 80th minute when substitute ivan kaviedes broke the offside trap before sliding the ball across goal and giving delgado an easy tap-in . familiar territory for poland poland , who have twice finished third at the world cup , in 1974 and in 1982 , enjoyed plenty of possession but were short on ideas in the final third of the pitch , although they did hit the woodwork twice in the closing stages . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ecuador captain ivan hurtado had to leave the game early due to injury it was mainly superb defending by south american four-man defense that kept poland from equalizing early in the second half and gave ecuador their second competitive win away from the thin air of quito , which at 2,850 meters -lrb- 9,350 feet -rrb- above sea level provides a unique soccer atmosphere . the loss was a repeat performance for poland who also lost their opener in the last world cup 2-0 to south korea and did n't get out of the group phase . ecuador , who finished behind brazil in argentina in their qualifying group to reach their second world cup finals , next face costa rica while poland take on hosts germany . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germany start cup campaign in style against costa rica world cup hosts and tournament opening act : germany might have been under pressure but their 4-2 win in the opening match against costa rica certainly was n't wracked with nerves .
-lrb- june 9 , 2006 -rrb- world cup 2006 click here for dw-world.de 's complete world cup coverage .
live ticker poland 0:2 ecuador review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker .
www-links dw-world.de 's world cup live ticker click here to keep following the action minute by minute .
feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

the 80th minute when substitute ivan kaviedes broke the offside trap before sliding the ball across goal and giving delgado an easy tap-in . familiar territory for poland poland , who have twice finished third at the world cup , in 1974 and in 1982 , enjoyed plenty of possession but were short on ideas in the final third of the pitch , although they did hit the woodwork twice in the closing stages . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ecuador captain ivan hurtado had to leave the game early due to injury it was mainly superb defending by south american four-man defense that kept poland from equalizing early in the second half and gave ecuador their second competitive win away from the thin air of quito , which at 2,850 meters -lrb- 9,350 feet -rrb- above sea level provides a unique soccer atmosphere . the loss was a repeat performance for poland who also lost their opener in the last world cup 2-0 to south korea and did n't get out of the group phase . ecuador , who finished behind brazil in argentina in their qualifying group to reach their second world cup finals , next face costa rica while poland take on hosts germany . dw staff -lrb- south american surprise puts ecuador even with germany -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 09.12.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 south american surprise puts ecuador even with germany großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ecuador 's edison mendez , right , congratulates teammate agustin delgado the 2006 world cup did n't take long to deliver it 's first surprise result .
ecuador shutout a favored poland side in gelsenkirchen friday night and took a big step toward moving into the next round . stuck in a group with the host nation , both poland and ecuador knew a win in their opening game would be crucial to their world cup campaign and were aiming for three points before suffering though a match against home favorite germany . carlos tenorio broke the deadlock in the 24th minute with a stooping header and agustin delgado made the points safe for the south americans with a simple tap-in 10 minutes from time . a long throw-in from the right touchline was flicked on by the gangly delgado and tenerio 's angled header just eluded poland keeper artur boruc 's outstretched hand for his sixth goal in 30 international appearances . ecuador killed off the contest in the 80th minute when substitute ivan kaviedes broke the offside trap before sliding the ball across goal and giving delgado an easy tap-in . familiar territory for poland poland , who have twice finished third at the world cup , in 1974 and in 1982 , enjoyed plenty of possession but were short on ideas in the final third of the pitch , although they did hit the woodwork twice in the closing stages . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ecuador captain ivan hurtado had to leave the game early due to injury it was mainly superb defending by south american four-man defense that kept poland from equalizing early in the second half and gave ecuador their second competitive win away from the thin air of quito , which at 2,850 meters -lrb- 9,350 feet -rrb- above sea level provides a unique soccer atmosphere . the loss was a repeat performance for poland who also lost their opener in the last world cup 2-0 to south korea and did n't get out of the group phase . ecuador , who finished behind brazil in argentina in their qualifying group to reach their second world cup finals , next face costa rica while poland take on hosts germany . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germany start cup campaign in style against costa rica world cup hosts and tournament opening act : germany might have been under pressure but their 4-2 win in the opening match against costa rica certainly was n't wracked with nerves .
-lrb- june 9 , 2006 -rrb- world cup 2006 click here for dw-world.de 's complete world cup coverage .
live ticker poland 0:2 ecuador review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker .
www-links dw-world.de 's world cup live ticker click here to keep following the action minute by minute .
feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 south american surprise puts ecuador even with germany großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ecuador 's edison mendez , right , congratulates teammate agustin delgado the 2006 world cup did n't take long to deliver it 's first surprise result .
ecuador shutout a favored poland side in gelsenkirchen friday night and took a big step toward moving into the next round . stuck in a group with the host nation , both poland and ecuador knew a win in their opening game would be crucial to their world cup campaign and were aiming for three points before suffering though a match against home favorite germany . carlos tenorio broke the deadlock in the 24th minute with a stooping header and agustin delgado made the points safe for the south americans with a simple tap-in 10 minutes from time . a long throw-in from the right touchline was flicked on by the gangly delgado and tenerio 's angled header just eluded poland keeper artur boruc 's outstretched hand for his sixth goal in 30 international appearances . ecuador killed off the contest in the 80th minute when substitute ivan kaviedes broke the offside trap before sliding the ball across goal and giving delgado an easy tap-in . familiar territory for poland poland , who have twice finished third at the world cup , in 1974 and in 1982 , enjoyed plenty of possession but were short on ideas in the final third of the pitch , although they did hit the woodwork twice in the closing stages . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ecuador captain ivan hurtado had to leave the game early due to injury it was mainly superb defending by south american four-man defense that kept poland from equalizing early in the second half and gave ecuador their second competitive win away from the thin air of quito , which at 2,850 meters -lrb- 9,350 feet -rrb- above sea level provides a unique soccer atmosphere . the loss was a repeat performance for poland who also lost their opener in the last world cup 2-0 to south korea and did n't get out of the group phase . ecuador , who finished behind brazil in argentina in their qualifying group to reach their second world cup finals , next face costa rica while poland take on hosts germany . dw staff -lrb- germany opens world cup without ballack -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 09.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 25.09.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 09.06.2006 germany opens world cup without ballack großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : michael ballack , the most important man in germany , is out of action on friday rumors about german team captain michael ballack 's presence at the world cup curtain raiser against costa rica have been laid to rest - the star midfielder will be spending the game on the bench . german coach jürgen klinsmann dashed germany 's hopes on friday when he ruled out captain michael ballack , suffering from a calf strain , in the opener against costa rica on friday . tim borowski will take ballack 's place instead in the all-important curtain raiser . earlier on friday , ballack declared himself fit and eager to play . he was quoted by a german paper as saying he feels fine and wants to play . " i 've had intensive treatment , " he told mass-circulation bild .
" i feel fit , i 'm pain-free .
i want to play . " " i want to play , " screamed the headline on the top selling bild newspaper and television and radio seized on the story , filling their programmes with renewed speculation on the state of " the country 's calf " . wait over bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : costa rica - not to be under-estimated the waiting is finally over , as germany kick off the 2006 soccer world cup finals against costa rica in munich .
fans from around the globe have descended on the country to cheer on their national teams . ballack had missed the final training session in munich because of an injury to a calf muscle he picked up against colombia a week ago and appeared to be ruled out of the opener . world cup organizer franz beckenbauer , meanwhile , had warned against ballack playing too soon , and insisted his injury is simply too risky . " a calf injury is dangerous , " he said .
" it 's important to be careful .
if something were to happen to him then he would be completely out of the running , " he said on morning television . challengers bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the team 's been training hard costa rica fans seem to be free of the problems dogging their opponents at the moment , and spent thursday fine-tuning their game . klinsmann says the central americans should n't be underestimated . " we have a lot of respect for costa rica like all our opponents , " said the coach .
" they are a strong side , with four or five very good players . " " we want to play at full pace from the first minute onwards and try and get the crowd behind us , " he said . and if that works , germany hope they can make their mark on the world cup from the very first game . dw staff -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germany captain michael ballack out for opener germany captain michael ballack wo n't be fit enough to take the field in the 2006 world cup opener against costa rica on friday , team coach jürgen klinsmann announced thursday .
-lrb- june 8 , 2006 -rrb- hosts plot costa rica 's downfall as world cup kicks off the waiting is almost over .
nearly six years after germany was awarded the 2006 world cup , the globe 's biggest soccer spectacle is ready to kick-off in munich friday with the hosts playing costa rica in the first game .
-lrb- june 9 , 2006 -rrb- germany captain ballack criticizes klinsmann 's tactics german captain michael ballack has taken issue with coach jürgen klinsmann 's tactics just eight days before the world cup host 's opening match against costa rica .
-lrb- june 1 , 2006 -rrb- feedback should klinsmann allow ballack to play in the opening match ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

" they are a strong side , with four or five very good players . " " we want to play at full pace from the first minute onwards and try and get the crowd behind us , " he said . and if that works , germany hope they can make their mark on the world cup from the very first game . dw staff -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germany captain michael ballack out for opener germany captain michael ballack wo n't be fit enough to take the field in the 2006 world cup opener against costa rica on friday , team coach jürgen klinsmann announced thursday .
